00125 {

00134         : m_name(name), m_type(type), m_enabled(false)
00135     {}
00136 
00137 
00141     bool IsEnabled() const      { return m_enabled; }
00142 
00146     void SetEnabled( bool enabled ) { m_enabled = enabled; }
00147 
00148 
00152     const wxString& GetName() const { return m_name; }
00153 
00157     DebugType GetType() const   { return m_type; }
00158 
00159 private:
00161     wxString    m_name;
00163     DebugType   m_type;
00165     bool        m_enabled;
00166 };

00320 DECLARE_LOCAL_EVENT_TYPE(MULE_EVT_LOGLINE, -1)
00321 
00322 
00323 
00324 class CLoggingEvent : public wxEvent
00325 {
00326 public:
00327     CLoggingEvent(bool critical, bool toStdout, bool toGUI, const wxString& msg)
00328         : wxEvent(-1, MULE_EVT_LOGLINE)
00329         , m_critical(critical)
00330         , m_stdout(toStdout)
00331         , m_GUI(toGUI)
00332         // Deep copy, to avoid thread-unsafe reference counting. */
00333         , m_msg(msg.c_str(), msg.Length())
00334     {
00335     }
00336     
00337     const wxString& Message() const {
00338         return m_msg;
00339     }
00340 
00341     bool IsCritical() const {
00342         return m_critical;
00343     }
00344 
00345     bool ToStdout() const {
00346         return m_stdout;
00347     }
00348 
00349     bool ToGUI() const {
00350         return m_GUI;
00351     }
00352 
00353     wxEvent* Clone() const {
00354         return new CLoggingEvent(m_critical, m_stdout, m_GUI, m_msg);
00355     }
00356     
00357 private:
00358     bool        m_critical;
00359     bool        m_stdout;
00360     bool        m_GUI;
00361     wxString    m_msg;
00362 };

00369     DECLARE_EVENT_TABLE_ENTRY(MULE_EVT_LOGLINE, -1, -1, \
00370     (wxObjectEventFunction) (wxEventFunction) \
00371     wxStaticCastEvent(MuleLogEventFunction, &func), (wxObject*) NULL),

00374 // access the logfile for EC
00375 class CLoggerAccess
00376 {
00377 private:
00378     class wxFFileInputStream * m_logfile;
00379     class wxCharBuffer * m_buffer;
00380     size_t m_bufferlen;
00381     size_t m_pos;
00382 
00383     bool m_ready;
00384 public:
00385     //
00386     // construct/destruct
00387     //
00388     CLoggerAccess();
00389     ~CLoggerAccess();
00390     //
00391     // Reset (used when logfile is cleared)
00392     //
00393     void Reset();
00394     //
00395     // get a String (if there is one)
00396     //
00397     bool GetString(wxString & s);
00398     //
00399     // is a String available ?
00400     //
00401     bool HasString();
00402 };

00415 #ifdef MULEUNIT
00416     #define AddDebugLogLineN(...) do {} while (false)
00417     #define AddLogLineN(...) do {} while (false)
00418     #define AddLogLineNS(...) do {} while (false)
00419     #define AddDebugLogLineC(...) do {} while (false)
00420     #define AddLogLineC(...) do {} while (false)
00421     #define AddLogLineCS(...) do {} while (false)
00422 #else
00423 // Macro for UPnP. This is not a debug macro, but wants its category printed nevertheless (sigh).
00424     #define AddLogLineU(critical, type, string) theLogger.AddLogLine(__TFILE__, __LINE__, critical, type, string)
00425 // Macros for 'N'on critical logging
00426     #ifdef __DEBUG__
00427         #define AddDebugLogLineN(type, string) theLogger.AddLogLine(__TFILE__, __LINE__, false, type, string)
00428     #else
00429         #define AddDebugLogLineN(type, string)  do {} while (false)
00430     #endif
00431     #define AddLogLineN(string) theLogger.AddLogLine(__TFILE__, __LINE__, false, logStandard, string)
00432     #define AddLogLineNS(string) theLogger.AddLogLine(__TFILE__, __LINE__, false, logStandard, string, true)
00433 // Macros for 'C'ritical logging
00434     #define AddDebugLogLineC(type, string) theLogger.AddLogLine(__TFILE__, __LINE__, true, type, string)
00435     #define AddLogLineC(string) theLogger.AddLogLine(__TFILE__, __LINE__, true, logStandard, string)
00436     #define AddLogLineCS(string) theLogger.AddLogLine(__TFILE__, __LINE__, true, logStandard, string, true)
00437 // Macros for logging to logfile only
00438     #define AddDebugLogLineF(type, string) theLogger.AddLogLine(__TFILE__, __LINE__, false, type, string, false, false)
00439     #define AddLogLineF(string) theLogger.AddLogLine(__TFILE__, __LINE__, false, logStandard, string, false, false)
00440 #endif
